alert.note: Alert for Berks; Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 15 at 2:50AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of New Jersey...and Pennsylvania...including the following areas...in New Jersey...Hunterdon, Morris, Somerset, Sussex, and Warren. In Pennsylvania...Berks, Carbon, Lehigh, Monroe, Northampton, Upper Bucks, and Western Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 6 AM EDT early this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms are expected with embedded heavy rainfall. Rainfall rates of 1-2 inches per hour are possible. Urban areas will be of particular concern for flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

area.areaDesc: Berks; Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery
